parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.51</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns how good the weapon of the vehicle is aimed at the target. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicle '''aimedAtTarget''' [target, weapon] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Weapons </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>


</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [target, weapon]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> target: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> weapon: [[String]] - (optional) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - 0...1 </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code> _aimingQuality = heli [[aimedAtTarget]] [target];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code> _aimingQuality = heli [[aimedAtTarget]] [target,"M197"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[fireAtTarget]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on November 19, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
The command doesn't work with soldier weapons, only vehicle weapons (in Arma 3 at least). The return value is either 1 or 0, very rarely the value falls in between. 1 doesn't mean you are going to hit the target, while 0 means you're definitely off.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
